FuncDef:
The apply peer-id command configures an ID for a peer group.
The undo apply peer-id command cancels the configuration.
By default, no ID is configured for a peer group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an ID for a BGP peer group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Many attacks are initiated by bogus sources. Therefore, BGP peer-based URPF needs to be deployed on the interfaces connecting the backbone network (including IGWs) and external networks to prevent IP spoofing attacks and reduce bandwidth on the IGWs and backbone network.
The apply peer-id command generates a mapping between the peer group ID and the interface for the device to determine whether to discard the received traffic to prevent attacks.
